quote.text: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judaea in the days of Herod the king, behold, there came wise men from the east to Jerusalem,
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Saying, Where is he that is born King of the Jews? for we have seen his star in the east, and are come to worship him.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: When Herod the king had heard these things, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together, he demanded of them where Christ should be born.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And they said unto him, In Bethlehem of Judaea: for thus it is written by the prophet,
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And thou Bethlehem, in the land of Juda, art not the least among the princes of Juda: for out of thee shall come a Governor, that shall rule my people Israel.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then Herod, when he had privily called the wise men, enquired of them diligently what time the star appeared.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And he sent them to Bethlehem, and said, Go and search diligently for the young child; and when ye have found him, bring me word again, that I may come and worship him also.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: When they had heard the king, they departed; and, lo, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, till it came and stood over where the young child was.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceeding great joy.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And when they were come into the house, they saw the young child with Mary his mother, and fell down, and worshipped him: and when they had opened their treasures, they presented unto him gifts; gold, and frankincense and myrrh.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And being warned of God in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they departed into their own country another way.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And when they were departed, behold, the angel of the Lord appeareth to Joseph in a dream, saying, Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and be thou there until I bring thee word: for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: When he arose, he took the young child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt:
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And was there until the death of Herod: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying, Out of Egypt have I called my son.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked of the wise men, was exceeding wroth, and sent forth, and slew all the children that were in Bethlehem, and in all the coasts thereof, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had diligently enquired of the wise men.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet, saying,
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: In Rama was there a voice heard, lamentation, and weeping, and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children, and would not be comforted, because they are not.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeareth in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Saying, Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel: for they are dead which sought the young child's life.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And he arose, and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: But when he heard that Archelaus did reign in Judaea in the room of his father Herod, he was afraid to go thither: notwithstanding, being warned of God in a dream, he turned aside into the parts of Galilee:
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophets, He shall be called a Nazarene.
quote.author: Matthew
